sentences: Mino Cinélu (born March 10, 1957) is a French musician.
Cinelu was born in Saint-Cloud, Hauts-de-Seine.
His father is from Martinique and his mother is French.

He was involved with music from childhood as his father and two brothers were musicians, and started spending time and playing in various concert halls such as the Chapelle des Lombards in the suburbs of Paris.
At the end of the 1970s he became more and more interested in the French jazz fusion scene where he made many connections with other musicians and members of the music industry.
In 1979 he moved to New York City.
In 1979 he moved to New York City. After a difficult start he met several musicians living in and around the city such as George Benson, Wayne Shorter, Kenny Barron, and Cassandra Wilson.
In the beginning of the 1980s he met Miles Davis while playing in a soul band at the New York club Mikkel's.
After a month of rehearsals, Cinelu went on tour with Miles Davis' band.
Starting in the 1990s Cinelu began working on a solo career.
His first solo album self-titled Mino Cinelu was released in 2000.
